text: Robert Bush Sebra (December 11, 1961 â€“ July 22, 2020) was an American professional baseball player. He played as a pitcher. He played in Major League Baseball (MLB) from 1985 to 1990, for the Texas Rangers, Montreal Expos, Philadelphia Phillies, Cincinnati Reds and Milwaukee Brewers. He threw and batted right-handed. He was born in Ridgewood, New Jersey. On July 22, 2020, Sebra died from multiple organ failure in Miami, Florida. He was 58. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1961 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:American baseball players Category:Cincinnati Reds players Category:Disease-related deaths in Florida Category:Milwaukee Brewers players Category:Montreal Expos players Category:People from Ridgewood, New Jersey Category:Philadelphia Phillies players Category:Sportspeople from New Jersey Category:Texas Rangers players
title: Bob Sebra
